Question: Do you hold any other professional qualifications? If yes, please enter them separated by commas.

Question: Do you write software as part of your job?
Comment: To easily filter out those who do not write software

Question: Who uses the code that you write?
Comment: Scale from Mostly myself to Mostly other people. To identify whether they're just using their own code, or writing for other people

Question: Do you consider yourself a professional software developer?
How many years of software development experience do you have?
In an average month, how much time do you spend on software development (Please rate your answer between 1 to 10. 1 Being none at all and 10 being All your time.)
Comment: Interval scale: 1 (None at all) -2 – 3 – 4 – 5 – 6 -7 – 8 – 9 – 10 (All my time)

Question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on research
Comment: Interval scale: 1 (None at all) -2 – 3 – 4 – 5 – 6 -7 – 8 – 9 – 10 (All my time)

Question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on management
Comment: Interval scale: 1 (None at all) -2 – 3 – 4 – 5 – 6 -7 – 8 – 9 – 10 (All my time)

Question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on teaching

Question: In an average month, how much time do you spend on other activities

Question: What is the duration of your current contract?

Question: Do you primarily work across multiple disciplines?
Comment: Allows us to check whether they see themselves as a multi-disciplinary person

Question: Please select all the disciplines you are working for
Source of information: Same source as for academic field

Question: What was your previous job?
How important were the following features to your decision to accept your current position?
Source of information: RSE interviews, review main features that people liked in their job
Comment: Want to get more info on what parts of the job attracted people to the position

Question: How many years have you been coding professionally?
Do you provide help and expertise in software development to researchers from across your organisation?
Comment: Updated English

Question: What percentage of your time do you spend developing software each week?

In general, when your software contributes to a paper, are you acknowledged in that paper?

Question: Are you generally named as the main author of the paper?
Comment: Changed phrasing to be more general

Question: Are you generally named as a co-author of the paper?
Comment: Changed phrasing to be more general

If yes, which conference(s)/workshop(s)
What is the bus factor of your most important software project?
Is there a technical hand-over plan for your most important software project?
Do you work for a Research Software Group?

Question: How many software projects are you currently involved in?
How are your projects typically tested (check all that apply)?
Format: No formal testing, the developers do their own testing, dedicated test engineers, user testing
